trans-unit.source: Configures the output cache profile that can be used by the application pages.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `add` element of the `outputCacheProfiles` section in the `caching` section of a configuration file.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> object centralizes frequently used configuration settings such as dependencies, cache location, and cache expiration time, eliminating the need to specify them on every page.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> can be applied to a page using the `CacheProfile` attribute of the directive.

The directive can override all the settings contained by an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> object except for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Enabled%2A> attribute.
This is to enable or disable the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> without having to modify the directives in all the pages that might have overridden it.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> class monitors the dependencies so that when any cached item changes, the cached item will be automatically removed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile"></xref> class.
The name value to use.
Gets or sets the time duration during which the page or control is cached.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Duration%2A> represents the time in seconds that the page or user control is cached.
Setting this property establishes an expiration policy for HTTP responses from the page or control to which it applies and will automatically cause the caching of their output.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Duration%2A> must be defined in either the profile or the directive of a page using the profile.
The time duration in seconds.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether caching is enabled.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Enabled%2A> property allows enabling or disabling the caching mechanism in one place only.
It affects all the pages or controls that use this <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile>.
`true` if caching is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the output cache location.

If <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Location%2A> is set to `Any`, the output cache can be located on the browser client, where the request originated; on a proxy server, or any other server, participating in the request; or on the server where the request was processed.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation"></xref> enumeration values.
The default is `Any`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile"></xref> name.

You use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.Name%2A> to assign a value to the `CacheProfile` attribute of the directive if you want to apply the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile> values to a page or control.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile"></xref> name.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether secondary storage is enabled.

The page that has the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.NoStore%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property set to `true` issues a response specifying in its header to prevent secondary storage of sensitive information.
Setting this attribute to `true` is equivalent to invoking the <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.SetNoStore%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method during a Web request.
`true` if secondary storage is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.SqlDependency"></xref> property.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.SqlDependency%2A> defines a relationship between a Web application and an instance of SQL Server, allowing the detection of changes in the data at the server.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.SqlDependency%2A> ensures that output cached pages are removed from the cache whenever the SQL table on which they depend changes.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> class monitors the table so that when the table changes, the item will be automatically removed from the Cache.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.SqlDependency"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the semicolon-delimited set of content encodings to be cached.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByContentEncoding%2A> settings are the same ones used by the `VaryByContentEncoding` attribute of the directive.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByContentEncoding%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The list of content encodings.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByControl"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByControl%2A> is a semicolon-delimited set of IDs of controls to be cached.
For more information, see [Caching Multiple Versions of User Control Output](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7f7d839a-c060-4d2a-9c4e-7fd1080ec0ad).
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByControl%2A> settings are the same ones used by the `VaryByControls` attribute of the directive.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByControl"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom%2A> can be any text that represents custom output-caching requirements.
If a custom string is entered, you must override the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication.GetVaryByCustomString%2A> method in the application's Global.asax file.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom%2A> settings are the same ones used by the `VaryByCustom` attribute of the directive.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByCustom"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader%2A> is a semicolon-delimited set of headers used to vary the cached output.
These are HTTP headers associated with the request.
For more information, see [Caching Multiple Versions of a Page](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c60284a9-9899-4fdc-a97c-020766b7572e).
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader%2A> settings are the same ones used by the `VaryByHeader` attribute of the .
Varying by all headers by setting the value of "*" is not recommended.
It can result in cache overflow or a denial of service attack on the Web server.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByHeader"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByParam"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByParam%2A> is a semicolon-delimited set of parameters used to vary the cached output.
It allows varying the cached output by GET query string or form POST parameters.
For instance, you can vary the user-control output to the cache by specifying the user-control name along with either a query string or a form POST parameter.
For more information, see [Caching Multiple Versions of User Control Output](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7f7d839a-c060-4d2a-9c4e-7fd1080ec0ad).
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByParam%2A> setting must be defined in either the profile or the directive of the page using the profile.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByParam%2A?displayProperty=fullName> settings are the same ones used by the `VaryByParam` attribute of the .
Varying by all parameters by setting the value of "*" is not recommended.
It can result in cache overflow or a denial of service attack on the Web server.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.OutputCacheProfile.VaryByParam"></xref> value.
